explanation: The claim is not correct. The allegedly invariant if is placed inside a conditional compilation block (#if defined(_DEBUG) || ! defined(USE_ACCEPT4)). When USE_ACCEPT4 is defined and _DEBUG is not, that #if is false and the entire if (! use_accept4 && ...) block is not compiled into the translation unit, so there is no controlling expression to be flagged. In the case where the block is compiled (i.e. _DEBUG is defined or USE_ACCEPT4 is not defined), use_accept4 is either a run-time value (the _DEBUG && USE_ACCEPT4 branch initializes it from daemon->avoid_accept4) or the block is compiled only when USE_ACCEPT4 is not defined (so use_accept4 cannot be the static true case). Therefore you do not end up with a compiled, invariant controlling expression. Consequently the reported MISRA C:2023 Rule 14.3 violation is incorrect for the provided code as it stands.
